intro: Froelichia interrupta var. colimensis, commonly known as the Mexican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. The flowers bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
